titles.title: A resolution to welcome the holding of democratic elections in Pakistan, to congratulate Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto on the occasion of her swearing-in, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S14202-14204)
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 10/21/1993--Introduced. Welcomes the elections of October 6 and 9, 1993, in Pakistan as an important step in reaffirming democracy. Congratulates Prime Minister Bhutto on the occasion of her swearing in on October 19, 1993. Reaffirms the existing ties of friendship between the peoples of Pakistan and the United States and underscores continuing U.S. interest in working with the Government of Pakistan on issues of bilateral and regional concern.
